listitem.para: Reads a line from the read stream (initially the popup dialog) and outputs that line as a list. The line is separated into elements as though it were typed in square brackets in an instruction. If the read stream is a file, and the end of file is reached, READLIST outputs the empty word (not the empty list). READLIST process's backslash, vertical bar, and tilde characters in the read stream; the output list will not contain these characters but they will have had their usual effect. READLIST does not, however, treat semicolon as a comment character.

listitem.programlisting: SHOW READLIST Hello how are you? [Hello how are you?]
